Name: Amritmahal
Characteristics:
Amritmahal is also known as 'Doddadana', 'Jawari Dana', and 'Number Dana'.
Usually grey in color with variations from white to almost black.
Horns are long, backward, and upward, ending in sharp black points.
Breeding Tract: Chikmagalur, Chitradurga, Hassan, Shimoga, Tumkur, and Davanagere districts of Karnataka

Name: Bachaur
Characteristics:
Bachaur is also known as 'Bhutia'.
Compact with straight backs.
Horns are medium-sized, curving outward, upward, and downward.
Breeding Tract: Sitamarhi, Darbhanga, and Madhubani districts of Bihar

Name: Badri
Characteristics:
Badri is small-sized, active, and sure-footed.
Common colors are black, brown, or grey.
Horns are curved upward and inward.
Breeding Tract: Nainital, Almora, Bageshwar, Pithoragarh, Champawat, Pauri Garhwal, Tehri Garhwal, Rudraprayag, Uttarkashi, and Chamoli districts of Uttarakhand

Name: Bargur
Characteristics:
Brown in color with white markings.
Horns are light brown, backward, outward, and upward with a forward curve, sharp at the tip.
Breeding Tract: Bargur hills in Bhavani taluk of Erode district, Tamil Nadu

Name: Belahi
Characteristics:
Also known as Morni or Desi.
Reddish brown, grey, or white color.
Horns are sickle-shaped curving upwards and inwards.
Breeding Tract: Shivalik in Haryana (Ambala, Panchkula, Yamunanagar districts) and Chandigarh

Name: Binjharpuri
Characteristics:
Medium-sized and strong, chiefly white but sometimes grey, black, or brown.
Horns are medium-sized and curved upward and inward.
Breeding Tract: Jajpur, Kendrapara, and Bhadrak districts of Odisha

Name: Dagri
Characteristics:
Small-sized with compact body, usually white or with grey shade.
Horns are short, thin, curved upward in a lyre shape.
Breeding Tract: Godhara/Panch Mahals, Dahod, Narmada, Chhotaudepur, and Mahisagar districts of Gujarat

Name: Deoni
Characteristics:
Usually spotted black and white.
Has strains like Balankya, Wannera, and Waghyd.
Drooping ears and prominent forehead.
Breeding Tract: Balaghat range of Sahyadri hills in Maharashtra

Name: Gangatiri
Characteristics:
Complete white or grey.
Horns are medium-sized and curve upwards and inwards.
Breeding Tract: Bhojpur district of Bihar and Varanasi, Mirzapur, Ghazipur, and Ballia districts of Uttar Pradesh

Name: Gaolao
Characteristics:
Blackish white in males, white in females.
Horns are short and stumpy.
Breeding Tract: Balaghat, Chhindwara, Seoni districts of Madhya Pradesh; Durg and Rajnandgaon districts of Chhattisgarh

Name: Gir
Characteristics:
Red or speckled red color.
Horns are peculiarly curved, giving a half-moon appearance.
Long, pendulous ears folded like a leaf.

Name: Hallikar
Characteristics:
White to light grey.
Horns are straight, upward, and backward with pointed tips.
Breeding Tract: Mysore, Mandya, Bangalore, Kolar, Tumkur, Hassan, and Chitradurga districts of Karnataka

Name: Hariana
Characteristics: White or light grey, coffin shaped skull, long narrow face, small horns
Breeding Tract: Hisar, Rohtak, Sonepat, Gurgaon, Jind, Jhajjar (Haryana)

Name: Himachali Pahari
Characteristics: Black or blackish brown, compact cylindrical body, short legs
Breeding Tract: Chamba, Kangra, Kinnaur, Kullu, Mandi, Shimla, Sirmaur, Lahul and Spiti (Himachal Pradesh)

Name: Kangayam
Characteristics:
Also known as 'Kanganad' and 'Kongu'.
The breed is usually grey or white in color.
Coat is red at birth and changes to grey at about 6 months.
Males are generally grey with black markings on the head, neck, hump, and quarters.
Cows are white and grey with deep markings above the fetlocks.
Horns are crescent-shaped, curving backward, outward, upward, and inward.
Breeding Tract: Coimbatore, Erode, Dindigul, Karur, Namakkal (Tamil Nadu)

Name: Kankrej
Characteristics:
Also known as 'Wadad', 'Vagadia', and 'Talabda'.
Resistant to tick fever, heat stress, and contagious abortion.
Coat color varies from silver grey to iron grey and steel black.
Large, pendulous ears and lyre-shaped horns.

Name: Kenkatha
Characteristics:
Also known as 'Kenwaria'.
Small, sturdy, and powerful.
Color varies from grey on the barrel to dark grey on the rest of the body.
Horns emerge forward and end in sharp points.

Name: Khariar
Characteristics:
Coat color is mainly brown and sometimes grey.
Small-sized and strong-built animals with straight horns.
Hump, neck, face, and back have dark shades.

Name: Kherigarh
Characteristics:
Small but active animals with white coat color, occasionally grey on the face.
Horns curve outward and upward.
Good draught bullocks.

Name: Konkan Kapila
Characteristics:
Also known as 'Konkan Gidda'.
Animals are reddish brown, black, white, grey, or mixed in color.
Compact body with straight forehead and black muzzle.

Name: Khillar
Characteristics:
Also known as 'Mandeshi' and 'Thillar'.
Males are dark over the fore and hindquarters with grey-white mottled faces.
Quick and spirited gait.

Name: Kosali
Characteristics:
Light red followed by whitish grey.
Horns are stumpy and emerge straight, then outward, upward, and inward.
Small to medium-sized hump.

Name: Krishna Valley
Characteristics:
Common color is grey-white with darker fore and hindquarters in males.
Females are more whitish in appearance.
Breeding Tract: Belgaum, Raichur, Bijapur (Karnataka), Satara, Sangli, Solapur (Maharashtra)

Name: Ladakhi
Characteristics:
Black or brown color, compact body adapted for mountainous terrains.
Small hairy forehead and slightly long face.

Name: Lakhimi
Characteristics:
Small-sized, brown or grey, dual-purpose breed.
Small hump and bowl-shaped udder.

Name: Malnad Gidda
Characteristics:
Predominant coat color is black with light fawn shades on thighs and shoulders.
Small and compact body frame.

Name: Malvi
Characteristics:
White or greyish with darker neck, shoulders, hump, and quarters.
Known for endurance and ability to carry heavy loads.

Name: Mewati
Characteristics:
Usually white with darker neck and shoulders.
Horns are small to medium and curve outward, upward, and inward.

Name: Nagori
Characteristics:
White and grey with long and narrow face.
Large pendulous ears.

Name: Rathi
Characteristics:
Usually brown or black with white patches.
Efficient milkers.

Name: Red Sindhi
Characteristics:
Dark red to dim yellow color.
Known for heat tolerance and high milk yield.
Breeding Tract: Various states (Orissa, Tamil Nadu, Bihar, Kerala, Assam)

Name: Sahiwal
Characteristics:
Brownish red with darker bulls.
Well-developed udder and good slope at rump.

Name: Vechur
Characteristics:
Considered the smallest cattle breed in the world.
Light red, black, or fawn and white in color.
Horns are extremely small and often not visible.

Name: Motu
Characteristics:
Coat colour is mainly brown (reddish) and sometimes grey.
Few animals are white in colour.
Small-sized but strong in build.

Name: Nimari
Characteristics:
Also known as 'Khargaon', 'Khargoni', and 'Khurgoni'.
Red in colour with large white splashes and massive body.
Horns usually emerge backward from the outer angles of the poll.

Name: Nari
Characteristics:
Also known as 'Sirohi'.
The color of animals varies from white or greyish white; bulls are white, greyish white, or black.
Medium-sized animals with spirally curved, outward/forward horns, which are long and thick at the base with pointed tips.
Forehead is broad and slightly concave in most cases.
Breeding Tract: Banaskantha and Sabarkantha districts (Gujarat); Pali and Sirohi districts (Rajasthan)

Name: Ongole
Characteristics:
Glossy white coat.
Males possess dark markings on head, neck, and hump.
Large fan-shaped dewlap, stumpy horns.
Breeding Tract: East Godavari, Guntur, Ongole, Nellore, Kurnool districts (Andhra Pradesh)

Name: Podu Thurpu
Characteristics:
Also known as Thurpu.
White coat with brown or red patches.
Horns are straight or curved, broad at base.

Name: Ponwar
Characteristics:
Black and white intermixed patches with no fixed pattern.
Medium-sized horns curve outward, upward, and inward.

Name: Pulikulam
Characteristics:
Also known as 'Palingu maadu' and 'Mattu maadu'.
Small-sized, compact body with dark grey males and white or grey females.
Horns curve outward, upward, backward, and inward.
